member.summary: Gets the array of UITestControl that will be used for Searching. It either returns new UITestControl array with modified SearchProperties or returns null when no modification is needed. member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl.EnsureValid(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Make this UITestControl valid if this has become invalid.
member.param: If true then it will call WaitForReady() on the element.
Refetch the control if not available
member.remarks: We dont need WaitForReady() to be called in EnsureValid if next call(e.g. Click, DoubleClick etc) goes through playback engine. The playback engine takes care if the element is not ready. If we call WaitForReady() in such cases it will cause little perf hit. For other cases like GetProperty()/SetProperty() we directly call on IAfxElement so we need WaitForReady() to be called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl.WaitForControlReady
member.summary: Blocks the current thread until the control is ready to accept mouse/keyboard input, or until the timeout specified by PlaybackSettings.WaitForReadyTimeout expires.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl.WaitForControlReady(System.Int32)
member.summary: Blocks the current thread until the control is ready to accept mouse/keyboard input, or the specified timeout expires.
member.param: The maximum number of milliseconds to wait, or System.Threading.Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
member.returns: True if the control is ready, false otherwise.
member.remarks: When the wait operation results in an implicit search for the control or, when the application is busy, the actual wait time could be more than the timeout specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.BrowserWindow.ExecuteScript(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes the script inside the browser with the given arguments.
member.exception: If there are any script errors or invalid arguments
member.param: Script to be executed.

Arguments for the script. Arguments can be double, long, bool, string, HtmlControl or a List<object> where object can be any one of the aforementioned types. Script should specify arguments as per ECMA standards. For example, the script "var result = addnumbers(arguments[0], arguments[1])" with arguments (2,3) will get executed by substituting arguments[i] with the corresponding argument value. Incorrect argument index in script w.r.t number of actual arguments provided will result in an UITestJscriptExecutionException.
member.returns:
Supports the following Return types:
1) Primitive types: Double, Long, bool, String.
2) HtmlControl if the script returns the elements from the web page.
3) List of objects:List<object> where object follows same rules as before. Nested Lists are supported.
If UITest fails to find one or more HtmlControl(s) while returning from script, then the return value will be NULL and not UITestControlNotAvailableException.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Keyboard.SendKeys(System.String)
member.summary: Sends the keystrokes to generate the specified text.
member.param: Text to generate.
member.remarks: The text may contain modifier key info. The modifiers keys are - ^ ControlKey + ShiftKey % AltKey # WinKey If any characters representing modifiers keys are to be sent then it should be enclosed in braces like {+}. And to send braces, enclose it in barces like {{} and {}}
member.example: SendKeys("^a"). This will send Control+a to TestControl.

member.example: SendKeys("^a"). This will send Control+a to TestControl.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ActionLogFormatter.GetAncestorInformation(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl,System.String@)
member.summary: If no friendly name is found on the element for a particular action, element's ancestor is searched for a better friendly name. This method returns the newly generated friendly name which gives the position of the element in its ancestor along with the ancestor's information
member.param: The given dot separated UI Object Name.
The UI Map. This is needed to get the ancestor of an object.
The returned value of friendly type name of the ancestor.
member.returns: The friendly type name of the ancestor.
member.remarks: Strangely, when the UI object is deserialized from an XML file, the ancestor information for UI Object is not filled. Therefore we cannot rely on uiObject.Ancestor. That is the reason we pass around UIMap.

member.summary: Gets the friendly name of a control
member.param: control under consideration
the controls type
whether or not to consider desktop element if control is null
member.remarks: If the control is not found we get friendly name from queryid. Any exceptions thrown as a result of getting friendly name are supressed so that the corresponding warning and error messages are logged properly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ColorDifference
member.summary: Represents the per-channel difference between two colors, used to represent tolerance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ColorDifference.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ColorDifference class using values of zero, indicating zero tolerance. Alpha is set to 255, indicating maximum tolerance for transparency.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ColorDifference class, setting red, green and blue to specified value. Alpha is set to 255, indicating maximum tolerance for transparency.
member.param: The red,green and blue color channel difference.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ColorDifference class, using the specified red, green and blue values. Alpha is set to 255, indicating maximum tolerance for transparency.
member.param: The red color channel difference.
The green color channel difference.
The blue color channel difference.

member.param: The alpha (transparency) color channel difference.
The red color channel difference.
The green color channel difference.
The blue color channel difference.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ColorDifference.MeetsTolerance(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ColorDifference)

member.returns: True if this color is less than or equal to reference on all channels.

member.summary: Returns a color object representing the margin by which the reference color difference missed the expected tolerance.
member.param: The reference color difference which exceeded the tolerance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.PlaybackSettings.MaximumRetryCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of times a retry can be done for a single action via PlaybackError handler in a coded ui test.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.PlaybackSettings.MatchExactHierarchy
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to match exact hierarchy specified for searching this control. Each control is specified as a hierarchy of containing controls for the search. If this flag is set to true, all ancestors of the control will be searched in order to locate this control. If this flag is set to false, some of the ancestors may be skipped during the search. For example, if the hierarchy of a control is A;B;C;D if A is found but playback fails to find full hierarchy B->C->D under it, then directly search for D under A if this property is set to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.PlaybackSettings.SkipSetPropertyVerification

member.summary: If true, sends as scan-code else as unicode.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITechnologyManagerProxy.ParseQueryId(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Parses the query element string and returns the parsedQueryIdCookie to be used later during Search() or MatchElement() or GetChildren() call for either searching or matching or getting children that has the same query string. EXT-PROTO1-NOTES: This is required so that the plugin part of the QID is correctly parsed and playback engine later calls into the plugin's MatchElement() again with that plugin part of QID.
member.param: The query element string to parse.
The cookie of the parsed QueryId to be used later.
member.returns: The remaining part of query element string that is not supported by this technology manager. The framework may or may not support the remaining part.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITechnologyElementProxy.IsTreeSwitchingRequired
member.summary: Gets whether the tree switching is required for window-less tree switching cases.
member.remarks: An example of this would be an ActiveX control hosted inside the browser. The technology manager of the browser should return true when queried about this property for HTML OBJECT tag. This will allow the framework to switch to a different technology manager to support the hosted ActiveX control.

member.summary: Gets the name of this element.

member.summary: Gets the underlying native technology element (like IAccessible) corresponding this element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITechnologyElementProxy.QueryId
member.summary:
Gets a QueryId that can be used to uniquely identify/find this element. In some cases, like TreeItem, the QueryIds might contain the entire element hierarchy but in most cases it will contain only important ancestors of the element. The technology manager needs to choose which ancestor to capture in the hierarchy by appropriately setting the QueryId.Ancestor property of each element.
The APIs in condition classes like AndCondition.ToString() and AndCondition.Parse() may be used to convert from this class to string or vice-versa.
EXT-PROTO1-NOTES: This QID also recursively converts all the ancestor core technology elements into the extension element and stitches the ancestor hierarchy appropriately.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITechnologyElementProxy.SwitchingElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the container element if one technology is hosted inside another technology. This is used by the framework.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITechnologyElementProxy.TopLevelElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the top level window corresponding to this element. The top level windows are typically children of desktop. If this is not set, the framework will set this to the top-most ancestor of the element (after ignoring the desktop as ancestor).
member.returns: The top level window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Playback.CaptureScreenShot(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.UITestControl)
member.summary: Captures desktop screen shot and highlights bounds of control; if bounds cannot be obtained for the control, its container is tried. - Highlights in red if bounds for current controls are found, to indicate that the last operation on this control is failed. - Highlights container bounds in green to indicate that search for a particular control within the container is failed. It also resets the TakeNextFailureScreenShot flag so that this method will not create infinite loop due the exceptions occuring within this method itself.
member.param: control on which a failure has occurred

member.param: The current control.
The color to use.
member.returns: The bounds to use.

member.summary: This method determines if the input exception is a playback related exception. If it is then it raises the PlaybackError event and returns whatever PlaybackErrorOption was set to the EventArgs Result field.
member.param: If this is false, the playback error handler won't be called.
member.returns: PlaybackErrorOptions.Default if exception wasn't handled. Else whatever was chosen in handler

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Playback.TakeNextFailureScreenShot
member.summary:
Whether screen shot of desktop needs to be taken on next exception. If this flag is set, when a next exception occurs, a snap shot is taken, and the bounds of the corresponding failed control is highlighted in red. If search for corresponding control is failed, its container's bounds are highlighted instead in green.
Use LastFailureScreenShot property to retrieve the screen shot.

member.summary: Safely cast (i.e. QueryInterface) from one COM interface to another COM interface.
member.remarks: On failure, instead of returning null or throwing unknown exceptions (ranging from InvalidCastException to NullReferenceException), this throws UITestControlNotAvailableException which is gracefully handled.

The interface to which to cast.
member.param: The object to cast.
member.returns: The casted object.

member.summary: Try cast (i.e. QueryInterface) from one COM interface to another COM interface.

member.summary: Cast (i.e. QueryInterface) from one COM interface to another COM interface.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ImageComparer
member.summary: Class containing the utility methods for Image Comparison

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ImageComparer.Compare(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Image)
member.summary: Compares two images to check if they match exactly.
member.param: Actual image.
Expected image.
member.returns: True if the two images are exactly same.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ImageComparer.Compare(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Image,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ColorDifference)
member.summary: Compares two images based on the tolerance value for whole image.
member.param: Actual image.
Expected image.
Maximum allowable difference between argb of two images.
member.returns: True if the two images differ by amount less than specified tolerance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ImageComparer.Compare(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Image@)
member.summary: Compares two images to check if they match exactly, calculates the difference between the two images as a diff image.
member.param: Actual image.
Expected image.
An image whose argb values represent the difference between the two images.
member.returns: True if the two images match exactly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ImageComparer.Compare(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Image,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ColorDifference,System.Drawing.Image@)
member.summary: Compares two images based on the tolerance value for whole image.
member.param: Actual image.
Expected image.
Maximum allowable difference between argb of two images.
An image whose argb values represent margin by which tolerance has been missed.
member.returns: True if the two images differ by amount less than specified tolerance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ImageComparer.Compare(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Image,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ToleranceRectangle})
member.summary: Compares specific regions of two images by the area specified by Tolerance Rectangles. Returns true of the image difference lies within tolerance.
member.param: Actual Image
Expected Image
List of tolerance rectangles indicating area to compare and tolerance value.
member.returns: True if the two images meet to values specified in tolerance rectangles.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ImageComparer.Compare(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Image,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ToleranceRectangle},System.Drawing.Image@)
member.summary: Compares specific regions of two images by the area specified by Tolerance Rectangles. Returns true of the image difference lies within tolerance, computes the margin by which tolerance is missed as a diff image.
member.param: Actual image.
Expected image.
List of tolerance rectangles indicating area to compare and tolerance value.
An image whose argb values represent margin by which tolerance has been missed.
member.returns: True if the two images meet to values specified in tolerance rectangles.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ImageComparer.CompareInternal(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Image,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ToleranceRectangle},System.Drawing.Image@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal function which compares specific regions of two images by the area specified by Tolerance Rectangles. Returns true of the image difference lies within tolerance, computes the margin by which tolerance is missed as a diff image.
member.param: Actual image.
Expected image.
List of tolerance rectangles indicating area to compare and tolerance value.
An image whose argb values represent margin by which tolerance has been missed, created only if createOutImage is true.
If true, output image is created.
member.returns: True if the two images meet to values specified in tolerance rectangles.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ImageComparer.CompareInternal(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Image,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ColorDifference,System.Drawing.Image@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal function which compares two images tolerance value. Returns true of the image difference lies within tolerance, computes the margin by which tolerance is missed as a diff image.
member.param: Actual image.
Expected image.
Tolerace value.
An image whose argb values represent margin by which tolerance has been missed, created only if createOutImage is true.
If true, output image is created.
member.returns: True if the two images meet to values specified in tolerance value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ImageComparer.CompareInternal(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Snapshot,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Snapshot,Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Snapshot,System.Drawing.Image@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal function which compares two images tolerance map. Returns true of the image difference lies within tolerance, computes the margin by which tolerance is missed as a diff image.
member.param: Actual snapshot.
Expected snapshot.
Tolerance map.
An image whose argb values represent margin by which tolerance has been missed, created only if createOutImage is true.
If true, output image is created.
member.returns: True if the two images meet to values specified in tolerance map.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ImageComparer.CreateToleranceMap(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.ToleranceRectangle},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a Tolerance Map based on list of input tolerance rectangles.
member.param: The list of tolerance rectangles.
Height of the tolerance map to be created.
Width of tolerance map to be created.
member.returns: Snapshot representing the tolerance allowed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.WinControls.WinRow.GetUITestControlsForSearch
member.summary: Gets the array of UITestControl that will be used for Searching. It either returns new UITestControl array with modified SearchProperties or returns null when no modification is needed. The last element in the array should be the leaf element and previous element should be it's container and so on.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.WinControls.WinTable.GetCell(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the cell based on the row and column indices.
member.param: The 0-based row index of the cell.
The 0-based column index of the cell.
member.returns: The cell object.
member.remarks: Example - Get cell at 2, 5. Note index is 0 based. WinCell cell = myTable.GetCell(2, 5);

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.WinControls.WinTable.GetRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the row based on the row index.
member.param: The 0-based row index.
member.returns: The row object.
member.remarks: Example - Get 3rd row. Note index is 0 based. WinRow row = myTable.GetRow(2);

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.WinControls.WinTable.GetContent
member.summary: Gets the content of the table i.e. values of all the cells.
member.returns: The content of the table.
member.remarks: Example - Get the values of all the cells of the table string[] values = myTable.GetContent();

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.WinControls.WinTable.FindFirstCellWithValue(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the first cell with the given value.
member.param: The value to find for.
member.returns: The first cell with the value.
member.remarks: Example - Find first cell with value 'Coded UI Test'. WinCell cell = myTable.FindFirstCellWithValue("Coded UI Test");

member.summary: Gets the names of all the columns of the table.

member.summary: Gets the array of UITestControl that will be used for Searching. It either returns new UITestControl array with modified SearchProperties or returns null when no modification is needed. The last element in the array should be the leaf element and previous element should be it's container and so on.

member.summary: Gets the array of UITestControl that will be used for Searching. The last element in the array should be the leaf element and previous element should be it's container and so on.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.WpfControls.WpfTable.GetCell(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the cell based on the row and column indices.
member.param: The 0-based row index of the cell.
The 0-based column index of the cell.
member.returns: The cell object.
member.remarks: Example - Get cell at 2, 5. Note index is 0 based. WpfCell cell = myTable.GetCell(2, 5);

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.WpfControls.WpfTable.GetRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the row based on the row index.
member.param: The 0-based row index.
member.returns: The row object.
member.remarks: Example - Get 3rd row. Note index is 0 based. WpfRow row = myTable.GetRow(2);

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.WpfControls.WpfTable.FindFirstCellWithValue(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the first cell with the given value. This call might take significant time since cell is searched under each row.
member.param: The value to find for.
member.returns: The first cell with the value.
member.remarks: Example - Find first cell with value 'Coded UI Test'. WpfCell cell = myTable.FindFirstCellWithValue("Coded UI Test");

member.summary: Gets the content of the table i.e. values of all the cells.
